0.name: Apple Scab
0.description: A fungal disease that causes dark, scaly lesions on apple leaves and fruit.

1.name: Apple Black Rot
1.description: A fungal disease that causes circular black or brown spots on apple leaves and fruit.

2.name: Cedar Apple Rust
2.description: A fungal disease that causes orange spots on apple leaves and fruit, requiring cedar trees to complete its life cycle.

3.name: Healthy Apple
3.description: No visible signs of disease on the apple plant.

4.name: Healthy Blueberry
4.description: No visible signs of disease on the blueberry plant.

5.name: Cherry Powdery Mildew
5.description: A fungal disease that causes a white, powdery coating on cherry leaves and fruit.

6.name: Healthy Cherry
6.description: No visible signs of disease on the cherry plant.

7.name: Corn Gray Leaf Spot
7.description: A fungal disease that causes rectangular, grayish-brown lesions on corn leaves.

8.name: Corn Common Rust
8.description: A fungal disease that causes small, round, reddish-brown pustules on corn leaves.

9.name: Corn Northern Leaf Blight
9.description: A fungal disease that causes long, elliptical, grayish-green lesions on corn leaves.

10.name: Healthy Corn
10.description: No visible signs of disease on the corn plant.

11.name: Grape Black Rot
11.description: A fungal disease that causes dark lesions on grape leaves and shriveled, mummified fruit.

12.name: Grape Esca (Black Measles)
12.description: A complex fungal disease that causes leaf discoloration and shriveling of grape berries.

13.name: Grape Leaf Blight
13.description: A fungal disease that causes small, dark, angular spots on grape leaves.

14.name: Healthy Grape
14.description: No visible signs of disease on the grape plant.

15.name: Citrus Greening
15.description: A bacterial disease that causes yellowing of citrus leaves and misshapen, bitter fruit.

16.name: Peach Bacterial Spot
16.description: A bacterial disease that causes small, dark lesions on peach leaves, fruit, and twigs.

17.name: Healthy Peach
17.description: No visible signs of disease on the peach plant.

18.name: Bell Pepper Bacterial Spot
18.description: A bacterial disease that causes small, dark, raised spots on pepper leaves and fruit.

19.name: Healthy Bell Pepper
19.description: No visible signs of disease on the bell pepper plant.

20.name: Potato Early Blight
20.description: A fungal disease that causes dark, target-like spots on potato leaves.

21.name: Potato Late Blight
21.description: A fungal disease that causes dark, water-soaked spots on potato leaves and stems.

22.name: Healthy Potato
22.description: No visible signs of disease on the potato plant.

23.name: Healthy Raspberry
23.description: No visible signs of disease on the raspberry plant.

24.name: Healthy Soybean
24.description: No visible signs of disease on the soybean plant.

25.name: Squash Powdery Mildew
25.description: A fungal disease that causes a white, powdery coating on squash leaves.

26.name: Strawberry Leaf Scorch
26.description: A fungal disease that causes reddish-purple spots on strawberry leaves.

27.name: Healthy Strawberry
27.description: No visible signs of disease on the strawberry plant.

28.name: Tomato Bacterial Spot
28.description: A bacterial disease that causes small, dark spots on tomato leaves and fruit.

29.name: Tomato Early Blight
29.description: A fungal disease that causes dark, target-like spots on tomato leaves.

30.name: Tomato Late Blight
30.description: A fungal disease that causes dark, water-soaked spots on tomato leaves and fruit.

31.name: Tomato Leaf Mold
31.description: A fungal disease that causes yellow spots on the upper side of tomato leaves and gray mold on the underside.

32.name: Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot
32.description: A fungal disease that causes small, circular spots with dark borders on tomato leaves.

33.name: Tomato Spider Mites
33.description: An arachnid pest that causes yellowing and stippling of tomato leaves.

34.name: Tomato Target Spot
34.description: A fungal disease that causes circular, target-like lesions on tomato leaves and fruit.

35.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
35.description: A viral disease that causes yellowing and curling of tomato leaves.

36.name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
36.description: A viral disease that causes mottled green and yellow patches on tomato leaves.

37.name: Healthy Tomato
37.description: No visible signs of disease on the tomato plant.
